critique: This document is an executive order from 1939 exempting John G. Crane from compulsory retirement for one year. It is difficult to assess its ideological tilt as it pertains to a specific individual and does not reflect broad policy changes. The order has no implications for immigration, federalism, national security, economic regulation, or social inclusion. It could be argued that it slightly expands executive power by allowing an exception to a general rule, but the impact is minimal.
